text: Publius Cornelius Scipio was a Roman senator, who was active during the Principate. He was consul for the year 56 as the colleague of Quintus Volusius Saturninus.Paul A. Gallivan, "Some Comments on the Fasti for the Reign of Nero", Classical Quarterly, 24 (1974), pp. 291, 309 As he belongs to the family of the Cornelii Lentuli, one of the patrician branches of the Cornelii, his name may be Publius Cornelius Lentulus Scipio. Scipio was the son of Publius Cornelius Lentulus Scipio, suffect consul in 24, by his first wife, whose name has not yet been recovered. Publius Cornelius Scipio Asiaticus, suffect consul in 68, is known to have been his younger half-brother.Ronald Syme, The Augustan Aristocracy (Oxford: Clarendon Press, 1986), p. 299 == References == Category:1st-century Romans Category:Imperial Roman consuls Cornelius Scipio, Publius (56)
title: Publius Cornelius Scipio (consul 56)
